title: Comedy king Nick Kroll is bringing his sold-out Middle-Aged Boy tour to Australia
text:
Nick Kroll, the creator of the acclaimed Netflix series Big Mouth has announced he is bringing his sold out Middle-Aged Boy tour Down Under early next year.

The 41-year-old thrilled his Australian fans on Friday as he took to Instagram to reveal the exciting news in a clip posted via promoter Live Nation's official page.

'I wanna let you know that I'm coming to Sydney and I am coming to Melbourne, that's right, I said it right, Melbourne for my Middle-Aged Boy Tour', he began.

Adding: 'I'm coming to do stand-up in your beautiful country… and I will see you out in the outback.'

The Comedy Central star will perform at Sydney's Enmore Theatre on January 4th and at The Athenaeum in Melbourne on January 6th.

Nick is best known for writing, producing and starring in the critically acclaimed adult animation series Big Mouth, in which he voices more than thirty characters.

Funny never sleeps: Comedy king Nick Kroll announced he is bringing his sold-out Middle-Aged Boy tour to Australia in January 2020. Pictured on September 14 at the Emmy Awards

Described as a satirical take on his own childhood, Big Mouth follows a group of seventh graders, as they navigate their way through puberty in the suburbs of New York City.

For his work on the series, Nick was recently nominated for the Outstanding Animated Program at the 2019 Emmy Awards.

And despite all his success on the small screen, the comedy king's career shows no sign of slowing as he's now a certified box-office money maker.

The family: Finn Wolfhard, Nick Kroll, Charlize Theron, Chloe Grace Moretz, and Snoop Dogg all smile for a photo at the premiere of the movie last week. [Pictured] Oct 6, in Los Angeles

Nick stars alongside Hollywood heavyweights Charlize Theron and Chloë Grace Moretz in the newly released The Addams Family animated reboot.

The film did better than expected when it opened last weekend, pulling in a whopping $35 million, and beating out Will Smith's new movie Gemini Man.

According to Deadline the figure prompted studio MGM greenlight plans for it's follow-up with an anticipated release date of October 22, 2021.

Nick famously dated fellow comedian Amy Poehler for two years, after her split from husband of nine years and Parks and Recreation co-star Will Arnett in 2012.
